summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons medical and administrative record documenting the death of Jeffrey Epstein by suicide via hanging in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York on August 10, 2019. It details his medical history, medications, and the timeline of his mental health monitoring and suicide watch status prior to his death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The 66-year-old male inmate who died by suicide via hanging in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York on August 10, 2019. The document is his medical and death record.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein Intake
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was processed into the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York.

events.title: Placed on Suicide Watch
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was placed on suicide watch following an incident involving a string/rope around his neck.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell with ligature marks around his neck. The cause of death was ruled a suicide by hanging (asphyxiation).

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York (referred to as 'NYM' in the document)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide via hanging (asphyxiation) in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, on August 10, 2019.
Epstein had been placed on suicide watch on July 23, 2019, following a prior incident involving a string/rope around his neck, which he later denied was a suicide attempt.
In daily encounters from July 23 through August 8, 2019, Epstein denied suicidal ideation, intention, or plan, and staff reported no unusual behaviors.
Epstein had a cell mate and was interacting with him prior to the incident.
The document lists Epstein's medical conditions, including hypertension, hyperlipidemia, sleep apnea, pre-diabetes, and constipation.
